messages.message:
The “import from URL” feature in conversations doesn’t seem to work too well with pure Markdown content. Many sites (our documentation site included) have started exposing a purely Markdown version of pages, with the idea that it’s supposed to make it easier for LLMs to understand the content (https://llmstxt.org/). However, when I tried importing from the Markdown version of a docs page (https://docs.instabase.com/admin/assigning-roles/llms.txt) , in the process of generating the PDF it seems key information was stripped? None of the checkmarks in the tables came through (image and text version of the captured content attached).

Not sure if this is just…how it works with PDFs, but if so it would be great to have support for importing Markdown in Markdown.
Oh and just to be clear I didn’t download then upload a markdown file, I just tried to use the Upload from URL feature. So it was imported as a PDF as stated, but not…very well.
Yeah I think we technically support it but our approach with URLs is to just turn everything into a PDF. @Rosie did you try uploading a markdown? how does that work?

We don't support Markdown, somehow. It's not on our list of supported files.
https://docs.instabase.com/overview/limitations#supported-file-types

I downloaded + uploaded as a `.txt` file and it worked fine (`.txt` is what the page saves by as default when you *right click > save as* for an _/llms.txt_ page). So idk I guess PDF conversion just doesn’t like unicode checkmarks? Would still be a lovely (and convenient) conversation feature to support non-PDF importing from an _/llms.txt_ endpoint.
Yeah that is a good feedback cc: @margaret.tomaszczuk for URL conversion. I also think supporting .md natively would be great
